item.title: Install the Nvidia driver on Ubuntu
item.description: I wrote a script to install the NVIDIA driver on Ubuntu: wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/johanburati/ms/master/ubuntu-install-cuda.sh chmod +x ubuntu-install-cuda.sh You can use it like this: Install CUDA 9.1: ./ubuntu-install-cuda.sh Install CUDA 9.0: ./ubuntu-install-cuda.sh 9 Install CUDA 8.0: ./ubuntu-install-cuda.sh 8 Uninstall CUDA: ./ubuntu-install-cuda.sh purge Tested on Date Image Kernel Result 2018-01-13 Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:latest 4.13.0-1005-azure OK 2018-01-14 Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:latest 4.13.0-1006-azure OK

item.title: Redhat Recommendations for Azure
item.description: The following are recommendation from Redhat for VMs running in Microsoft Azure. Option Recommendation LVM Do not use Logical Volume Manager (LVM) on the operating system disk. Use regular partitions and format the disk using ext3, ext4, or xfs. LVM or RAID can be used for data disks. ssh ssh must be enabled to provide remote access to your Azure VMs. dhcp The primary virtual adapter should be configured for dhcp (IPv4 only).
